sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true catechisme concerning the word of God and the power of it, which is quick and lively in the heart the manner of its working by dividing and setting before the creature good and evil ... : also several questions answered by the experimental working of the spirit ... / written by one who is brought into the true Christian faith, and for the testimony of the same faith hath been cast into prison ... and scornfully called Quaker, whose name is Thomas Richardson. Richardson, Thomas.
[2], 38 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the Year 1664.
Place of publication from Wing (2nd ed.). "Wisbitch Goal [sic], the 24th of the 2d. Month, 1664." Imperfect: stained and tightly bound. Reproduction of original in the Friends' Library (London, England).
=======

Richardson, Thomas.
[2], 38 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the Year 1664.
Place of publication from Wing (2nd ed.). "Wisbitch Goal [sic], the 24th of the 2d. Month, 1664." Imperfect: stained and tightly bound. Reproduction of original in the Friends' Library (London, England).
